data.benefits: Scheme provides 50% as subsidy or maximum of Rs 20 lakhs p.a. for the purchase of testing equipment.
data.eligibility: All existing industrial units located anywhere in the State are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. The unit must have filed Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) and Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM). 
  2. The unit should not be in the restrictive list as notified by the State Government. 
  3. The unit must have obtained No objection certificate from the competent authority if applicable. 
  4. The unit should be in commercial production. 
  5. The unit should be in regular production at the time of disbursement. Subsidy is not applicable for secondhand testing equipment. 
  6. The equipment should not be disposed of for 5 years without approval.
data.beneficiaries: All existing industrial units located anywhere in the State are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. The unit must have filed Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) and Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM). 
  2. The unit should not be in the restrictive list as notified by the State Government. 
  3. The unit must have obtained No objection certificate from the competent authority if applicable. 
  4. The unit should be in commercial production. 
  5. The unit should be in regular production at the time of disbursement. Subsidy is not applicable for secondhand testing equipment. 
  6. The equipment should not be disposed of for 5 years without approval.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Haryana
data.context: In pursuance to the provision under Chapter 14 of Haryana Enterprises & Employment Policy-2020 notified in Gazette vide No.25/05/2020-4IB-I dated 29.12020, the Governor of Haryana notified "Testing Equipment Assistance Scheme"
data.objective: To ensure “Zero Defect” in the quality of products for global competition.
data.description: Scheme provides 50% as subsidy or maximum of Rs 20 lakhs p.a. for the purchase of testing equipment.
data.how_to_apply: Application on prescribed Form for the  grant of Testing Equipment Assistance  on the purchase of testing equipment, along with the documents should be submitted to the Director/ Director General, Industries & Commerce/Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises through the web portal of the department.
data.funding_facilitator: Directorate of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Haryana
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefits after the approval from the concerned auhtority.
data.additional_info:
Link of list of Restrictive Industries in Haryana: https://www.hsiidc.org.in/uploads/estate_managements/170097742718HEEP%20restrictive%20list.pdf 

Categorization of Blocks : https://investharyana.in/content/pdfs/Re-categorization%20of%20blocks%2015.11.2018.pdf
data.checklist_info_a:
Udyam Registration Certificate (URC)
Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM)
NOC/CLU (No Objection Certificate/Change of Land Use)
Haryana Resident Certificate (for local employment benefits)
ESI/PF Registration Number
Proof of Commercial Production
Financial Statements (Balance Sheet, Profit & Loss Statement)
Import-Exporter Code (IEC)
Registration-cum-Membership Certificate (RCMC) from Export Promotion Council
Land Documents (ownership or lease agreement)
Environmental Clearances (if applicable)
Zero Defect Zero Effect (ZED) Certification
Proof of Investment (in machinery/equipment)
Electricity Bills (for electricity-related incentives)
Energy Audit Report (for energy efficiency claims)
Other Miscellaneous Documents (as per specific schemes)
data.checklist_info_d:
Address :  Sh. Deepak Burak , Directorate of MSME
